item.title: PHP echo
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:5, topic:156586”]Oh sorry, didn’t see the single quotations. Is it because you didn’t add the “;”?

Perhaps this?

if (isset($vnamehere)) { $status = '<li><a href="#" title="">1</a></li>'; } else { $status = '<li><a href="#" title="">1</a></li>'; }[/quote]

Yay! That worked! And your [r.andom] tag hid your kewl little code xD.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP echo
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Oh sorry, didn’t see the single quotations. Is it because you didn’t add the “;”?

Perhaps this?

if (isset($vnamehere)) { $status = '<li><a href="#" title="">1</a></li>'; } else { $status = '<li><a href="#" title="">1</a></li>'; }

[random]Heres a little something I wrote just now that could be useful;

[code]<?php
$vnamehere = $_GET[‘id’];

if (isset($vnamehere)) {
	switch ($vnamehere){
		case heep:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"$vnamehere.php\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		case hax:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"$vnamehere.php\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		default:
			echo "Error!";
				break;
	}
} else {
	$status = "<li><a href=\"#\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
}
echo "$vnamehere";

?>[/code]

so if its ?id=heep, the link would be link.com/heep.php

One last quick edit

[code]<?php
$vnamehere = $_GET[‘id’];

if (isset($vnamehere)) {
	switch ($vnamehere){
		case heep:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"?id=$vnamehere\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		case hax:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"?id=$vnamehere\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		case oman:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"?id=$vnamehere\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		case nowai:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"?id=$vnamehere\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		case dud:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"?id=$vnamehere\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		case kek:
			$status = "<li><a href=\"?id=$vnamehere\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
			echo "$status<br /><br />";
				break;
		default:
			echo "Error!<br /><br />";
				break;
	}
} else {
	$status = "<li><a href=\"#\" title=\"\">1</a></li>";
}
echo "$vnamehere<br /><br />
<a href=\"?id=heep\">Test</a><br />
<a href=\"?id=hax\">Test</a><br />
<a href=\"?id=oman\">Test</a><br />
<a href=\"?id=nowai\">Test</a><br />
<a href=\"?id=dud\">Test</a><br />
<a href=\"?id=kek\">Test</a>";

?>[/code][/random]

Read full topic

item.title: PHP echo
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Try this:

if ($vnamehere = '') { $status = '<li><a href=\"#\" title=\"\">1</a></li>' } else { $status = '<li><a href=\"#\" title=\"\">1</a></li>' }

Did mastrchief forget ( ) around if statements?

item.title: PHP echo
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Well, since I’m in the WDOTM contest, I’m using PHP, but the only problem is I lost all the documentation I had on echoing variables and such. This is the code I have:

if $vnamehere = '' { $status = '<li><a href="#" title="">1</a></li>' } else { $status = '<li><a href="#" title="">1</a></li>' }

The problem is that when $vnamehere equals nothing, $status displays as:

1’ } else { $status = '2

’ } ?>

(1 and 2 are links, however)

I know is has something to do with having a > in the html code but what would I do to fix it? I worked it out before on my old site but unfortunately it got deleted.

Read full topic
